Description: Rim and shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery dinos; interior: streakily glazed with added red band on inside of rim; on top of rim, band of rays; outside glazzed; below, black figure decoration consisting of part of horse (ear, forelock, mane with red on alternate strands and top of bridle remaining), to left; at left, part of lotus flower with red on petal and leaf; incised spoked rosette with red on petals as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the horse's mane with alternating red and black strands and wavy bottom, see the Middle Corinthian column-krater Vatican 16448, dated c. 580-570 BC
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 289-290, no. B267)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0245) (Phase 1)
